chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install (2+)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Repeater]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Repeater] was dismissed by the court.

  • Ashley J. Lindquist was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Ashley J. Lindquist was found guilty of Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install (2+), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 347.413(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms.
Provide DNA sample & pay surcharge.   Payable out of 25% of inmate monies and by payment plan setup with agent.
Maintain absolute sobriety to include no purchase, possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician and then only according to physician's orders.
Enter into, participate in and successfully complete any assessments, evaluations and/or treatment programs as directed by the agent. Successfully complete a cognitive intervention program.
AODA assessment followed by treatment and aftercare.
Payable out of 25% of inmate monies and by payment plan set up with agent.
